Name: The Savelberg
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: Boozy with bready genever, pear, citrus and faint rich honey.
History: Created in 2016 by Jan Halfpap at Bar Le Lion in Hamburg, Germany. This riff on the classic Journalist cocktail is named after a Dutch journalist called Robert Savelberg, who lives and works in Berlin. Savelberg became famous in Germany due to his critical questioning during a press conference held over the coalition agreement of the new Federal Government in October 2009 and a subsequent satirical movie made by ZDF.
Nutrition: One serving of The Savelberg contains 167 calories
